channel.title: What do I have to Do to Host A server without being called a Leecher?
channel.description: Tell me? I figure if someone makes there source available it is so that other persons can host it for their friends but i want to make sure..

item.title: What do I have to Do to Host A server without being called a Leecher?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Da Vein:

I promise if you have to ask this, you’re going to be leeching.

Read full topic
item.source: What do I have to Do to Host A server without being called a Leecher?

item.title: What do I have to Do to Host A server without being called a Leecher?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

When your source cannot be defined as someone else’s source. Basically, changing quite a few things, a certain percentage. However, that percentage that you must change before it becomes yours, varies greatly. As someone stated before, you’re usually going to get called a leecher if you just take someones source, and change every instance of the server name to your new server name, same for old owners name, to your name. If you change the shops a bit, move some npcs, change the home area, and maybe even fix a few bugs to make it noticeably different, you shouldn’t have problems.

Read full topic
item.source: What do I have to Do to Host A server without being called a Leecher?

item.title: What do I have to Do to Host A server without being called a Leecher?
item.dc:creator: @Da_Vein Da Vein
item.description:
@Da_Vein wrote:

I promise if you have to ask this, you’re going to be leeching.

But, leeching is when you get someone else’s source, and just basically change it’s name then host it.
